1.text: Select a CBD-infused edible for the most discrete option.

2.text: Pick an oil tincture if you want to add CBD to your own food.

3.text: Check the product label to find the CBD concentration.

4.text: See if the CBD was extracted with CO2.

5.text: Look for CBD products that have been tested by a third-party lab.

6.text: Go to a CBD specialty store or dispensary if you want the edibles right away.

7.text: Use a cannabis delivery service for a convenient alternative.

8.text: Order directly from established brands using their websites.

9.text: Get drops of CBD added to your meals at restaurants if they offer it.

10.text: Use 1 dose at a time when you first start CBD edibles.

11.text: Take the edible 1–2 hours before you want to start feeling the effects.

12.text: Try another partial dose if you don’t feel the CBD within 2 hours.
